item.title: By: HappyJoe
item.dc:creator: HappyJoe
item.description: It's wrong with me 'export AppBar, AppCanvas; //, ...' with out {}..
item.content:encoded: It’s wrong with me ‘export AppBar, AppCanvas; //, …’ with out {}..

item.title: By: Song Yangyu
item.dc:creator: Song Yangyu
item.description:
Thanks for your post, it's quite helpful.
However, what if I want to do `export {* as api_utils} from './config';`
item.content:encoded:
Thanks for your post, it’s quite helpful.

However, what if I want to do `export {* as api_utils} from ‘./config’;`

item.title: By: James K Nelson
item.dc:creator: James K Nelson
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/re-exporting-es6-modules/#comment-5359">Tim Branyen</a>.
Thanks Tim, I've updated the article with this.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Tim Branyen.

Thanks Tim, I’ve updated the article with this.

item.title: By: Tim Branyen
item.dc:creator: Tim Branyen
item.description:
I recently tried the:
> export AppBar, AppCanvas; //, ... But Babel doesn’t even compile this.
feature and realized that it does work, you just forgot to add the surrounding { ... }. It should look something like:
export { AppBar, AppCanvas };
item.content:encoded:
I recently tried the:

> export AppBar, AppCanvas; //, …
But Babel doesn’t even compile this.

feature and realized that it does work, you just forgot to add the surrounding { … }. It should look something like:

export { AppBar, AppCanvas };
